content: I'm running zulip with two realms on a VPS with 20GB HDD, and I'm running low on space. So far I managed by manually removing unused kernels and logs, and duplicate versios of snap packages. But I wonder if it's safe to completely remove snapd including all snap packages? Does zulip use packages that are packaged as snaps, or is expected to do so in the future?
@Jonas F: Zulip Server doesn't make any use of snaps, so those are safe to remove.
OK I removed snapd (loosely following this), and the server still works!
